channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The Grange Estate, cleansing and weed killing needed, 12th June
item.description:
Brunel Drive, Castle Close, Wickham Grove and Cinder Close on The Grange Estate in Gotherington needs the highway and footpaths cleansing and weeds removing from the herb edged and footpaths. I believe it is two years since being adopted and has not been cleansed at all since adoption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Brunel Drive, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lyndley Chase junction On to Stoke Orchard Road, 12th June
item.description:
The exit coming out of Lyndley Chase on to Stoke Orchard Road is obscured by long grass. This has Been reported a while ago and is getting worse. An accident waiting to happen!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover missing, 12th June
item.description:
Drain cover has fallen in again and now the cone that's in it has been hit many times, been thrown in the bushes so drivers don't know there's a gaping hole there, basically the same cycle over and over. Needs fixing as somone on a bike or car, horse riders etc will be injured if they go in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cats driving through pedestrian green light, 12th June
item.description:
So many cars are turning right after their light turns red that they drive through the pedestrian crossing when the green light is lit. I've just crossed here and two cars drove through when the green pedestrian light was showing. I am thankfully funny sighted otherwise I have no doubt I would have been knocked down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109-111, Bath Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 12th June
item.description:
FMS report of overgrown trees/hedge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipped Metal Drum, 12th June
item.description:
The location is the Cleeve Common Road at the entrance to the Old Quarry (opposite Drypool Farm Entrance) The drum has been there for a few days and may contain other dry debris (note damage to drum). Can the area behind the entrance wall also be cleared up. Please can it be removed as soon as possible)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Noverton Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A fallen tree branch is blocking a path. The tree may still be vulnerable to dropping another large branch., 12th June
item.description:
Outside on the path of 53/55 Ermin Park. The branch fell at 2 30pm on 12/6/25.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Ermin Park, Brockworth, Gloucester

item.title: Dog poo on the pavement, 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dinglewell, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Flooded, 12th June
item.description:
The drains outside 99 Gretton Road (including a kerb gully) are not coping with heavy downpours causing flooding across the road and a large amount of water on the driveway of 99 Gretton Road. After a certain amount of rain the water comes completely across the road causing water to come over pavement at the property opposite (48 Gretton Road).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New fountain in Cirencester Road, 12th June
item.description:
Drain is on the boundary of 35 Cirencester Road on southbound side. It’s the furthest of three from the river. There is plainly an underground blockage so that all accumulation of runoff from a few hundred metres of roadway returns to the surface from this drain then forms a large puddle and drains away from the next two. Been happening for years nothing gets done. Have video.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Healthy tree, no need to cut!, 12th June
item.description:
There is a beautiful healthy tree outside 53 Kipling road, it was reduced today by the council, however I’m against for it to be reduced any further as it doesn’t bring any harm to anything, it adds character to our street and is a home for many birds.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Kipling Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Diy/building materials, 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 12th June
item.description:
There are signs still out from the footway construction from old bath road to London road in random areas please can you contact the traffic management who put signs out to arrange for them to be collected ASAP please unable to stop for photos
